title: 115_s1324
content: The "Disarm Hate Act" prevents individuals convicted of a misdemeanor hate crime or receiving an enhanced sentence for a misdemeanor due to hate or bias from obtaining a firearm. The term 'convicted in any court of a misdemeanor hate crime' refers to being convicted of a misdemeanor offense that was motivated by hate or bias based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, or disability, and involves the use of physical force or threats to safety. The term 'convicted in any court of a misdemeanor hate crime' refers to being convicted of a misdemeanor offense motivated by hate or bias and involving physical force or threats to safety. This does not include a conviction unless the person had legal representation or waived the right to counsel and had a jury trial if entitled to one. The curr_chunk states that a conviction of an offense can be disregarded if it has been expunged, set aside, pardoned, or if civil rights have been restored. The term 'received from any court an enhanced hate crime misdemeanor sentence' refers to a court-imposed sentence for a misdemeanor involving physical force or threat, motivated by hate or bias. The term 'received from any court an enhanced hate crime misdemeanor sentence' refers to a court-imposed sentence for a misdemeanor involving physical force or threat, motivated, in whole or in part, by hate or bias. It does not include the imposition of a sentence described unless certain conditions are met. The case was tried by a jury or the person waived the right to a jury trial. The imposition of a sentence can be affected if the conviction is expunged, set aside, pardoned, or civil rights restored. The amendment prohibits the sale of firearms to individuals convicted of misdemeanor hate crimes or receiving an enhanced hate crime misdemeanor sentence. The amendment prohibits individuals convicted of misdemeanor hate crimes or receiving an enhanced hate crime misdemeanor sentence from possessing, shipping, or transporting firearms.
